DOC.brief_title: Choice Of Optimal Strategy For Bifurcation Lesions With Normal Side Branch
DOC.detailed_description: Among bifurcation type , bifurcation lesion without significant side branch stenosis ( < 50 % ) usually require side branch stenting , owe several putative mechanism include dissection , thrombosis formation , embolization plaque debris , ostial compromise displace stent strut , snow plow effect , side branch might compromise . In situation , strategy achieve optimal result report . Recently , FFR study show jailed side branch ( vessel size > 2.0 mm . DS > 50 % ) main branch stenting functional significance . We compare strategy without routine kissing balloon dilatation le 50 % stenosis simple DES cross bifurcation lesion ( bifurcation type 1.1.0 , 1.0.0 , 0.1.0 accord Medina classification ) serial change FFR measurement .
DOC.criteria: Clinical Patients angina document ischemia patient document silent ischemia Patients eligible intracoronary stenting Age > 18 year , < 75 age Angiographic De novo lesion locate major bifurcation point MEDINA classification type 1.1.0 , 1.0.0 , 0.1.0 Main vessel : > = 2.5 mm vessel size , > = 50 % diameter stenosis = < 50 mm lesion length visual estimation , lesion cover = < 2 stent Side branch : > = 2.0 mm vessel size < 50 % diameter stenosis visual estimation History bleed diathesis coagulopathy Pregnant Known hypersensitivity contraindication contrast agent , heparin , sirolimus , paclitaxel zotarolimus Limited lifeexpectancy ( less 1 year ) due combine serious disease STelevation acute myocardial infarction = < 2 week Characteristics lesion : Left main disease Instent restenosis Graft vessel TIMI flow = < grade 2 side branch Chronic total occlusion Renal dysfunction , creatinine > = 2.0mg/dL Contraindication aspirin , clopidogrel cilostazol
